intro: Ruellia cucullata, commonly known as the hooded ruellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its showy blue or violet flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Ruellia cucullata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
